IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO GIVE STUDENTS IN THE GRADES OF 9 THRU 12 THE OPPORTUNITY OF DEVELOPING TO THE FULLEST EXTENT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO GIVE STUDENTS IN THE GRADES OF 9 THRU 12 THE OPPORTUNITY OF DEVELOPING TO THE FULLEST EXTENT POSSIBLE THE PARTICULAR GIFTS THAT ARE THEIRS AND TO ENCOURAGE IN THEM THE DESIRE TO DO SO.
IRS990.Desc: ST. GEORGE'S SCHOOL PRIMARILY PROVIDES INSTRUCTION AND STUDENT EDUCATION SUPPORT TO STUDENTS IN GRADES 9-12.

BooksInCareOfDetail.PersonNm: ELIZABETH F MCGRATH DIRECTOR OF F

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: DUE TO BENEFICIARIES OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF NUMEROUS FUNDS DONATED OR ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES. ITS ENDOWMENT FUNDS INCLUDE BOTH DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS AND UNRESTRICTED FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENT FUNDS. THE SCHOOL HAS ADOPTED INVESTMENT AND SPENDING POLICIES FOR ENDOWMENT ASSETS THAT INTEND TO PROVIDE A PREDICTABLE STREAM OF FUNDING TO PROGRAMS SUPPORTED BY ITS ENDOWMENT WHILE INTENDING TO MAINTAIN THE PURCHASING POWER OF THE ENDOWMENT ASSETS.
STUDENT AID/TUITION REMISSION -5,105,213. CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS 185,138.

ST. GEORGE'S SCHOOL ADMITS STUDENTS OF ANY RELIGION, RACE, COLOR, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, GENDER IDENTITY, GENDER EXPRESSION, AND NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN TO ALL THE PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES GENERALLY ACCORDED OR MADE AVAILABLE TO STUDENTS AT THE SCHOOL. IT DOES NOT DISCRIMINATE ON THE BASIS OF RELIGION, GENDER, RACE, COLOR, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, GENDER IDENTITY, GENDER EXPRESSION, OR NATIONAL OR ETHNIC ORIGIN IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF ITS EDUCATIONAL POLICIES, SCHOLARSHIP AND LOAN PROGRAMS, OR ATHLETIC AND OTHER SCHOOL-ADMINISTERED PROGRAMS.

AccountActivitiesOutsideUSGrp.SpecificServicesProvidedTxt: CULTURAL IMMERSION AND SHORT TERM INTERNSHIPS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MOST FUNDS ARE DISTRIBUTED AS CREDITS AGAINST CHARGES ON STUDENT ACCOUNTS, AND ARE MOSTLY FOR PURCHASES OF TUITION, LAPTOP COMPUTERS, TEXTBOOKS OR MEDICAL INSURANCE. THE FINANCIAL AID OFFICERS AND THE STUDENTS' ADVISORS MEET REGULARLY WITH THE STUDENTS RECEIVING AID TO REVIEW ANY EXPENSES.
THE ORGANIZATION IS A BOARDING HIGH SCHOOL. HOUSING IS PROVIDED FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE ORGANIZATION AS WELL AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT.
THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S BONUS IS RECOMMENDED BY THE BOARD CHAIR AND SUBSEQUENTLY REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE, BASED ON ACHIEVEMENT OF PERFORMANCE GOALS.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: RHODE ISLAND HEALTH & EDUCATION BUILDING CORPORATION
RHODE ISLAND HEALTH & EDUCATION BUILDING CORPORATION
RHODE ISLAND HEALTH & EDUCATION BUILDING CORPORATION

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PROJECTS FOR THE 2014 BONDS CONSIST OF THE FINANCING OF (1) THE PLANNING, ACQUISITION, CONSTRUCTION, EQUIPPING AND FURNISHING OF VARIOUS OF THE BORROWER'S FACILITIES LOCATED AT 372 PURGATORY ROAD IN MIDDLETOWN, RHODE ISLAND, AND ADJACENT AREAS TO BE USED IN FURTHERANCE OF THE SCHOOL'S EDUCATIONAL MISSION AND (2) THE REFINANCING OF THE OUTSTANDING DEBT OF THE SERIES 2010 AND 2003 BONDS. SCHEDULE K, PART II, LINE 11: BOND PROCEEDS WERE USED TO REFUND PRIOR ISSUES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD CHAIR AND THE CHAIR OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEW A COMPLETE COPY OF THE TAX RETURN, INCLUDING GIFTS, BEFORE FILING WITH THE IRS. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWS A DRAFT OF THE TAX RETURN, EXCLUDING GIFTS, BEFORE FILING. EMAIL NOTIFICATION IS SENT TO ALL TRUSTEES INFORMING THEM THAT THE FINAL VERSION OF THE TAX RETURN, EXCLUDING GIFTS, HAS BEEN POSTED TO THE TRUSTEES' WEBSITE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN ORDER TO MONITOR AND ENFORCE COMPLIANCE OF THE POLICY, A SIGNED CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS REQUIRED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HIRES AN EDUCATIONAL COMPENSATION CONSULTANT TO WORK ON THE HEAD OF SCHOOL'S COMPENSATION CONTRACT. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL REVIEWS DATA FROM COMPARABLE SCHOOLS TO ENSURE THAT SENIOR MANAGEMENT COMPENSATION IS IN LINE WITH OTHER SIMILAR SCHOOLS. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE PERTINENT DATA AND THE DECISION PROCESS WITH THE HEAD OF SCHOOL FOR SENIOR MANAGEMENT COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UPON REQUEST THE SCHOOL MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS 185,138.
